step1.sentence: After a year of studying philosophy, she realized she had barely scratched the surface of the subject.

step2.story: Maya spent three months researching climate change, only to realize she had barely scratched the surface. Entire subfields she hadn't even touched stretched out before her. Rather than feeling discouraged, she found the depth of the subject thrilling.

step3.story: When Lena first joined the neuroscience lab, she was confident she understood the basics. After all, she had read dozens of articles and aced her undergraduate exams. But on her first day, her supervisor handed her a thick stack of papers and said quietly, 'You've only scratched the surface—the real questions start here.' Lena stayed late every night that week, reading until her eyes blurred. Each paper revealed new layers of complexity she hadn't imagined. By Friday, she no longer felt confident—she felt genuinely curious for the first time in years.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 주제나 문제의 아주 일부분만 다루었다는 뜻으로, 탐구해야 할 것이 아직 훨씬 많이 남아 있음을 나타낼 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 표면을 긁는 행위에서 비유된 표현으로, 깊이 파고들지 않고 겉만 살짝 건드린 상태를 묘사합니다. 17세기경부터 비유적 의미로 쓰이기 시작했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 겸손하게 '아직 많이 부족하다'는 의미로도 쓰이고, '탐구할 여지가 무궁무진하다'는 기대감이나 설렘을 담아 쓸 수도 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: This book only scratches the surface of Japanese history.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이 책은 일본 역사의 표면만 건드릴 뿐입니다.
